title: Morristown National Historical Park: Park Home
body: Where America Survived  Morristown National Historical Park commemorates the sites of General Washington and the Continental armyâ€™s winter encampment of December 1779 to June 1780, where they survived through what would be the coldest winter on record. The park also maintains a museum & library collection related to the encampments & George Washington, as well as items relating to pre- and post-Revolutionary America.                Soldier at the Huts   Learn about the life of a common soldier during the winter encampment as you visit the replica soldier huts of the Pennsylvania Line.        Jockey Hollow Hiking Trails Map   Download a copy of the Jockey Hollow Hiking Trails Map (PDF) here or purchase one at the Visitor Center for $1.00.
